server

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.User

  • public abstract class User
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class containing static methods used for database communication The methods are synchronized so that two or more threads won't acces the database at the same time ensuring data integrity It uses the SQLite RDBMS as the database backend (needs the tables to be already created) and the SQLite JDBC connector
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marcin Gorczyñski
    See Also:
    http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Java_JDBC_using_SQLite, SQL, http://www.sqlite.org/

      User() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean create(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Creates/registers a user in the database returning if it succeded
      static boolean exists(java.lang.String username)
      Checks if the user exists in the database returning true or false as the answer
      static java.util.List<Message> getMessages(java.lang.String username)
      Gets all the messages to an user from the database and putting them in a LinkedList of Message objects
      static boolean login(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String ip)
      Login the user if he exists returning if the login was succesful
      static void logout(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Logs out the user
      static boolean online(java.lang.String username)
      Checks if the user is online at the moment returning the result
      static boolean sendMessage(java.lang.String fromUsername, java.lang.String toUsername, java.lang.String message)
      Sends a message from one user to another creating a message in the database

      • exists

        public static boolean exists(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if the user exists in the database returning true or false as the answer
        Parameters:
        username - the users username in the database
        Returns:
        true if the user exists, false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Connection, Statement

      • login

        public static boolean login(java.lang.String username,
            java.lang.String password,
            java.lang.String ip)
        Login the user if he exists returning if the login was succesful
        Parameters:
        username - the users username in the database
        password - the users password in the database
        ip - the users ip (the accepted connection ip)
        Returns:
        true if the user was logged in, false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Connection, Statement

      • sendMessage

        public static boolean sendMessage(java.lang.String fromUsername,
                  java.lang.String toUsername,
                  java.lang.String message)
        Sends a message from one user to another creating a message in the database
        Parameters:
        fromUsername - the username of the sender
        toUsername - the username of the receiver
        message - the content of the message
        Returns:
        true if sending was succesful, false otherwise
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Connection, Statement

      • getMessages

        public static java.util.List<Message> getMessages(java.lang.String username)
        Gets all the messages to an user from the database and putting them in a LinkedList of Message objects
        Parameters:
        username - the users username in the database
        Returns:
        the reference to the LinkedList with the messages
        Since:
        1.0
